a.title: Link to event:Memorial Day - Student & Staff Holiday
Link to event:Half Day for students
Link to event:Last Day of School
Link to event:Teacher Work and Professional Day - No School for Students

span.a: Teacher Work and Professional Day - No School for Students

div.div: During this unique and challenging time of school closures we know there are many questions regarding how students will be graded for the 4th quarter (elementary and middle schools) and second semester of the school year. We have been working diligently to develop a fair system to grade students while they are learning remotely.
The Fort Mill School District will provide breakfast and lunch free of charge during the duration of the school closure to families in need. Please follow the link for more details.

Governor Henry McMaster announced on March 24 that the state is extending the closure of schools through April 30, to slow the spread of the coronavirus. Our schools and offices will be closed to the public beginning Wednesday, March 25. If you need assistance, please leave a message using the main phone number at your school or the district office and your call will be returned by a staff member in a timely manner.
Please follow the link to access the eLearning guide for parents.
Kindergarten Registration opens March 2, 2020 for the 2020-2021 school year.
The 2020-2021 District Calendar is now available.

a.title: Learning Cottages Leased at BTMS for One Year

div.a: Learning Cottages Leased at BTMS for One Year
div.div: At the February 18 school board meeting, the board approved the recommendation by the administration to lease two custom built learning cottages to accommodate the large rising sixth grade class at Banks Trail Middle School for the 2020–2021 school year.

At the February 5 school board meeting, the district administration announced that due to unforeseen issues and poor weather condition throughout construction, and despite every effort to correct these delays, the opening of River Trail Elementary School will be delayed.
The district administration presented a recommendation for the 2020-2021 Academic Calendar at the February 5 school board meeting.

a.title: FMSD Inducts 2019 Class of Hall of Fame

div.a: FMSD Inducts 2019 Class of Hall of Fame
div.div: The Fort Mill School District inducted five new members into the district’s Hall of Fame with a ceremony and reception on Tuesday, January 21.

a.title: School Board Approves Dress Code Policy

div.a: School Board Approves Dress Code Policy
div.div: At the January 21 school board meeting the administration presented updates to the student dress policy to provide clarification on portions of the policy and changes in response to the parent feedback survey.

a.title: FMSD Placed on AP Honor Roll for Fourth Consecutive Year

div.a: FMSD Placed on AP Honor Roll for Fourth Consecutive Year
div.div: The Fort Mill School District is one of 250 school districts in the U.S. and Canada being honored by the College Board with placement on the 10th Annual AP® District Honor Roll.

a.title: Elementary and Middle School Attendance Areas

div.a: Elementary and Middle School Attendance Areas
div.div: At the November 5 school board meeting, the school board voted to approve the administration’s recommendation for the elementary and middle school attendance areas.

a.title: Fort Mill Outperforms State and National Averages

div.a: Fort Mill Outperforms State and National Averages
div.div: The Fort Mill School District has once again exceeded state and national averages on two significant benchmarks.

div.p: In the tradition of excellence, Fort Mill Schools place Children First . . . Every Day by providing an innovative and rigorous education that empowers all students to achieve their greatest success.
